reviewText: The video quality is what you would expect from a tv broadcast from the mid-70s. Its not distracting from the program, which is very interesting. Good historical record.
President Nixon was more open than I remember him. David Frost is an excellent interviewer. Great insight into a complex man.
Nixon's attempt "to climb the ladder" is unsuccessful:  TRUTH gets in the way!  Robert Holland.

The video quality is equal to a VCR tape at EP speed. Extremely disappointed in the video quality.  And the sad part is that this DVD is advertised as "Remastered". If this is remastered then the it must have been remastered from a 5th generation tape.

So why two stars? It's Richard Nixon, who is interesting in any format quality.
